intro: Hieracium fritzei, commonly known as the Fritze's hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It features a basal rosette of leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
